Stealth.label: Stealth
Stealth.description: Stealth is the ability to move silently and avoid detection.

Disguise.label: Disguise
Disguise.description: Disguise is the ability to alter one's appearance to avoid recognition.

Mimic.label: Mimic
Mimic.description: Mimic is the ability to imitate the voice or mannerisms of another.

Insight.label: Insight
Insight.description: Insight is the ability to read and understand the emotions and intentions of others.

ComprehendLanguages.label: Comprehend Languages
ComprehendLanguages.description: Comprehend Languages is the ability to understand and interpret languages.

Perception.label: Perception
Perception.description: Perception is the ability to notice and interpret sensory information.

Persuasion.label: Persuasion
Persuasion.description: Persuasion is the ability to convince others to accept your point of view.

ResistInfluence.label: Resist Influence
ResistInfluence.description: Resist Influence is the ability to withstand attempts to manipulate or control your mind.

Forage.label: Forage
Forage.description: Forage is the ability to search for and gather components and other resources.

MaintainFocus.label: Maintain Focus
MaintainFocus.description: Maintain Focus is the ability to maintain focus on spells when taking damage.

MaintainConcentration.label: Maintain Concentration
MaintainConcentration.description: Maintain Concentration is the ability to maintain concentration on spells when taking damage.

Grapple.label: Grapple
Grapple.description: Grapple is the ability to seize and hold onto a creature in combat.

TraverseDifficultTerrain.label: Traverse Difficult Terrain
TraverseDifficultTerrain.description: Traverse Difficult Terrain is the ability to navigate through difficult terrain and climb obstacles.

Accuracy.label: Accuracy
Accuracy.description: Accuracy is the ability to hit a target with a ranged or thrown weapon.

Devices.label: Devices
Devices.description: Devices is the ability to use and alter devices, such as computers or machinery.

COMMON.confirmUpdateGearType:
Are you sure you want to update the gear type?
This will remove all existing gear features.
COMMON.gmCraftItem:
No actor owns this item. As the GM you can craft it.
This will not create a new item, but will mark this item as crafted.
Craft anyways?

ERRORS.ArtistryNotUnlocked: At least one of the features of this spell is from an artistry that you haven't unlocked yet.
ERRORS.NotEnoughStamina:
You don't have enough stamina to cast this spell.
However, you can spend Deep Hitpoints (DHP) to in place of the remaining stamina, if you wish.
Cast this spell for {dhp} DHP?
ERRORS.NotEnoughActions: You don't have enough turn or interrupt actions to perform this action.
ERRORS.ReplaceSpecies: You must be a GM to replace the species of an actor.
ERRORS.ReplaceSpeciesGM:
As the GM, you can replace the species of this actor.
This will remove the existing species features and talents.
Are you sure you want to do this? (Talent points will be returned)
ERRORS.SpeciesDataNotFound: New characters don't have a species by default. Please select a species to see you character's data update.
ERRORS.NoTargetsSelected: The game rule "Target Required" is enabled, you must target at least one token to perform this action.
ERRORS.NoTargetsSelectedInfo: No tokens are targeted. Defense calculations will need to be performed manually.
ERRORS.ActionAgainstNoTarget: This action requires you to have a target, please target a token first.
ERRORS.NoSpeciesWarning: There is no species assigned to this actor. A species is required to browse talents.
ERRORS.NoConsumableQuantity: You're trying to consume a consumable that has no quantity. Craft a new one, or set the quantity to 1.
ERRORS.NoParentActor: This item is not owned by a character or creature. It cannot be equipped.
ERRORS.CraftingMacroNotFound: Crafting macro not found. Please ensure the macro is created, you may need to redefine the macro's UUID in the associated Gear Feature.
ERRORS.Encumbered: {actorName} is encumbered! They automatically have a point of fatigue applied to them.
ERRORS.CannotDeleteBaseAction: You cannot delete a base action of an actor. This action is inherit to the system.
ERRORS.SpellCostExceedsStamina: Your spellcap is too low to be able to cast this spell.
ERRORS.AdvancementPointsWarning: You have unspend talent points. You cannot level up until you spend them.
ERRORS.IncompatibleFeature: This feature is incompatible with another selected feature.
ERRORS.RequiredFeature: This feature is required by another feature. Delete that feature first.
ERRORS.ItemNotEquipped: This item is an equippable item, but it is not equipped. Please equip it first.
ERRORS.NotEnoughComponents: You don't have enough components to craft this item.

CHAT.DamagePreDefenses: Rolls below indicate damage before defenses are applied.
CHAT.DamageResponse: You're being targeted to recieve the above damage, how will you respond. If you don't wish to respond, you can ignore this message.

Buttons.Reset: Reset this setting to defaults (You will lose all changes)

Settings.targetRequiredHint: When enabled, you must target at least one token to perform attacks and actions that require a target.
Settings.highlightTemplateHint: Highlight currently-placing template for attacks and actions that have templates assigned to them.
Settings.autoRollAttacksHint: When enabled, attack rolls for gear and spells will be automatically rolled when the action is performed.
Settings.autoRollContestsHint: When enabled, tests and checks for all item types will be automatically rolled when the action is performed.
Settings.displayDamageHint: When enabled, damage for strikes will either be displayed accurately, with an estimate, or not at all. The formula will always be displayed regardless of this setting.
Settings.estimateDamageSimulationsHint: The number of simulations to run for damage estimates. Higher numbers will result in more accurate estimates, but will take longer to calculate.
Settings.diceRedistributionHint: By default, Utopia allows attack rolls to be redistributed to standard RPG dice sets based on the maximum possible output of a roll from the default formula. For example: 5d4 can be redistributed to 2d10 or 1d20. Players can customize this option with the "Dice Redistribution Size" setting themselves.
Settings.autoMaxDiceHint: Set the preferred dice redistribution size.
Settings.diceRedistributionSmallest: Use smallest dice size (higher average, lower maximums)
Settings.diceRedistributionLargest: Use largest dice size (higher maximums, lower average)
Settings.turnActionsMaxHint: Only applies to Character and NPC type actors only. This setting only applies to newly created actors. Action maximums can still be set with ActiveEffects.
Settings.interruptActionsMaxHint: Only applies to Character and NPC type actors only. This setting only applies to newly created actors. Action maximums can still be set with ActiveEffects.
Settings.displayActionsOnTokenHint: When enabled, turn and interrupt actions will appear on tokens on the map. This is enabled by default.
Settings.displayActionsOptionHint: Choose how actions should be displayed on tokens on the map.
Settings.displayActionsSizeHint: The size of the action indicators on tokens. This is basically a division of the size of the grid. You may need to tinker with this setting to get the right size for your preference.
Settings.restOnLevelUpHint: When enabled, and a character or NPC levels up, the rest action will be performed automatically. Resting sets Surface HP and Stamina to their maximums, and resets turn and interrupt actions to their maximums.
Settings.diceRedistributionDiceSizesHint: Comma separated list of the face counts of dice available for redistribution. By default, uses the the standard TTRPG dice set (d100, d20, d12, d10, d8, d6, d4). Do not include the 'd' when listing dice.

ForageAndCrafting.CraftingNotEnoughComponents: You don't have enough components to craft this component.

Actions.CreatureTalentsInfo: Drag-and-Drop talents to use them on creatures.

Actors.PaperDoll: Blue slots are augment slots | Drag equipment to a slot to fill it | Right-click to clear a slot

grants.label: Granted Items
grants.hint: Other talents, actions, gear, or otherwise granted by this item. These items are created as separate entities in the owning actor.

formula.label: Formula
formula.hint: The roll formula to execute. This may be used for damage, healing, a test, or otherwise.

rarity.label: Rarity
rarity.hint: The rarity of this item. This is used to determine the color of the item in the inventory and its value.

Messages.ErrorNoComponent: No such component or rarity found.
Messages.ErrorNotEnoughComponents: Not enough components of the specified rarity available to consume.
Messages.ErrorNegative: A provided formula returned a negative value.

ActionType.Current: Current Action Type (if in combat, defaults to Turn Action)

Harvest.Name: Harvest
Harvest.Info: After combat, you can harvest components from the defeated creature. Below is a table of options for each defeated creature.
Harvest.Complete: [GM Only] Complete Encounter and Distribute EXP
Harvest.TurnActions: Not enough Turn Actions to perform this action.

category.label: Category
category._hint: The category modifies the behaviour when performing the action.

resource.label: Resource
resource.hint: The resource (name) required to perform the action.

consumed.label: Amount Consumed
consumed.hint:
The amount of the resource consumed when performing the action.
Set to 0 to only check if the resource exists.

macro.label: Macro
macro.hint: The macro to execute when performing the action. Only works if the category is set to 'macro'.

actor.label: Affected Actor(s)
actor.hint: The actor(s) affected by the action.

range.label: Range
range.hint: The range of the action. This is represented in the format "close/far". i.e "20/40" for 20M close range, 40M far range.

accuracyTrait.label: Accuracy Trait
accuracyTrait.hint: The trait to use for the accuracy of the action. This is used for attack rolls and checks.

template.label: Damage and Effect Template
template.hint: The template to use for the damage and effects of the action.

cost.label: Cost
cost._hint: The turn or interrupt cost of the action. This can be a number or a formula.

stamina.label: Stamina
stamina._hint: The stamina cost of the action. This can be a number or a formula.

secret.label: Secret
secret.hint: Only visible to the owner of the actor and the GM.

checks.label: Checks and Tests
checks.hint: Select multiple to be able to choose when performing this action.

checkFavor.label: Check and Test Favor
checkFavor.hint: Enable for actor favors to be applied to the checks and tests performed by this action.

damages.label: Damage and Healing
damages.hint: The damage and healing effects of this action.

damageModifier.label: Damage Modifier
damageModifier.hint: The damage modifier to apply to the damage and healing effects of this action.

validityCheck.label: Only deal damage if a check is successful
validityCheck.hint: If enabled, the damage and effects of this action are only applied if the check is successful.

validityCheck.enabled.label: Enabled
validityCheck.enabled.hint: If enabled, the validity check is performed.

validityCheck.favor.label: Apply (Dis)Favor
validityCheck.favor.hint: Whether to apply favor to the check.

passive.scaling.enabled.label: Scaling Enabled
passive.scaling.enabled.hint: If enabled, apply a prompted scaling ratio on use.

passive.scaling.resource.label: Scaling Resource
passive.scaling.resource.hint: The resource to scale the passive effect with.

passive.scaling.ratio.label: Scaling Ratio
passive.scaling.ratio.hint:
Using a [resource]/[amount] format, e.g. '1/2' to scale the passive effect.
If only one value is present, no prompting will occur, and scaling will not apply.

passive.equipment.enabled.label: Automatically Roll Equipment
passive.equipment.enabled.hint: If enabled, will automatically roll (or prompt if multiple) the specified equipment

passive.equipment.mustBeEquipped.label: Must be Equipped
passive.equipment.mustBeEquipped.hint: Will only roll (or prompt if enabled) of equipment that is equipped.

passive.equipment.type.label: Equipment Type
passive.equipment.type.hint: The type of equipment required for the action.

passive.equipment.reduceActionCost.label: Reduce Action Cost
passive.equipment.reduceActionCost.hint: How should the equipment's action cost be modified by this action?

passive.equipment.reduceActionCostFlat.label: Flat Action Cost Reduction
passive.equipment.reduceActionCostFlat.hint:
The flat amount to reduce the action cost by.
Only used if 'Reduce Action Cost' is set to 'Flat'.

restoration.label: Enable Resource Restoration
restoration.hint: If enabled, and when this action is performed, will restore the specified resource, by the amount defined in this action's formula.

restorationType.label: Resource Type
restorationType.hint: The type of resource to restore when this action is performed.

toggleActiveEffects.label: Toggle Active Effects
toggleActiveEffects.hint: Active Effects on this item that transfer to the owner, will be toggled enabled / disabled when this action is used.

PassiveType.meleeRedirect: Redirect Overflow Melee Damage - Redirect damage past 0 DHP to another creature in range
PassiveType.rangedRedirect: Redirect Overflow Ranged Damage - Redirect damage past 0 DHP to another creature in range
PassiveType.travelPlusStunt: Travel + Stunt Score - Add stunt score to travel speed
PassiveType.blockWithWeapon: Block with Weapon - Use weapon's attack roll instead of creatures block rating
PassiveType.respondWithAttack: Respond with Attack - When sensing another creature attack, respond with an attack action
PassiveType.attackAllInRange: Attack All in Range - When attacking, roll to attack all creatures in range as a single action
PassiveType.reduceActionCost: Reduce Attack Cost - Reduce the action cost of equipment attack actions
PassiveType.ignoreDamageType: Ignore Damage - Ignore damage of a specific type

ScaleResource.cost: Based on this action's TA / IA cost
ScaleResource.stamina: Based on this action's stamina cost

block.quantity.label: Block Dice
block.quantity.hint: The number of d4's to roll for blocking.

dodge.quantity.label: Dodge Dice
dodge.quantity.hint: The number of d12's to roll for dodging.

harvest.label: Harvest
harvest.hint: The harvest settings for this body.

harvest.testDifficulty.label: Harvest TD
harvest.testDifficulty.hint: The test difficulty to harvest this item. You may use a formula.

harvest.componentFormula.label: Harvest Components
harvest.componentFormula.hint: The formula to determine the components harvested.

harvest.componentRarity.label: Harvest Rarity
harvest.componentRarity.hint: The rarity of the harvested components.

harvest.componentType.label: Harvest Type
harvest.componentType.hint: The type of the harvested components.

harvest.alwaysHarvestable.label: Always Harvestable
harvest.alwaysHarvestable.hint: The amount of components harvested when harvesting, regardless of the test.

harvest.testHarvestable.label: Test Harvestable
harvest.testHarvestable.hint: The additional amount of components harvested, if the test is successful.

points.label: DR Points
points.hint: The number of DR points this kit provides. Can be negative.

attributes.label: Kit Attributes
attributes.hint: The attributes this kit provides. In the format that ActiveEffects use. (eg. 'system.hitpoints.surface.max', '+5')

points.label: DR Points
points.hint: The number of DR points this kit provides. Can be negative.

type.label: Type
type.hint: The type of category this class belongs to. Only a certain amount of certain classes can be given to a creature.

attributes.label: Class Attributes
attributes.hint: The attributes this class provides. In the format that ActiveEffects use. (eg. 'system.hitpoints.surface.max', '+5')

Prototype.true: This item is a prototype, you must craft it before it can be used.
Prototype.false: This item has been crafted, it can be used immediately.

GearFeature.UneditableWarning: You cannot edit this feature directly. Please open the item in the Artifice Feature Builder to edit it.

consumeOnUse.label: Consume on Use
consumeOnUse.hint: Consume a quantity of this item when used.

deleteWhenEmpty.label: Delete When Empty
deleteWhenEmpty.hint: Delete this item (from the actor, not the world) when the quantity reaches 0.

container.capacity.label: Container Capacity
container.capacity.hint: The number of slots this container can hold.

container.items.label: Container Items
container.items.hint: The items this container holds. (Should not be modified directly)

quirkPoints.label: Quirk Points
quirkPoints.hint: The number of quirk points this species has.

communication.label: Communication
communication.hint: The communication settings for this species.

communication.language.choices.label: Languages
communication.language.choices.hint: The number of languages this species can choose from.

communication.language.languages.label: Languages
communication.language.languages.hint: The languages this species can speak.

communication.types.label: Communication Types
communication.types.hint: The types of communication this species can use.

transform.label: Transformation
transform.hint: The transformation settings for this species.

gifts.subtraits.label: Gifted Subtraits
gifts.subtraits.hint: The subtraits this species is gifted with.

gifts.points.label: Gifted Points
gifts.points.hint: The number of points to spend on gifted subtraits.

branchCount.label: Branch Count
branchCount.hint: The number of branches this species has.

options.choices.label: Offers Choices
options.choices.hint: If this talent offers choices, you can define them here.

options.category.label: Belongs to Choice Category
options.category.hint: Any talents that offer the same choices should be in the same category.

macro.label: Run Macro on Take
macro.hint: The macro to execute when this talent is gained or taken.

flexibility.label: Flexibility
flexibility.hint: Taking this talent allows the player to choose another talent from the specified category for an additional cost.

flexibility.body.label: Body Increase
flexibility.body.hint: The increase in body cost for the flexibility. +0 is the default.

flexibility.mind.label: Mind Increase
flexibility.mind.hint: The increase in mind cost for the flexibility. +0 is the default.

flexibility.soul.label: Soul Increase
flexibility.soul.hint: The increase in soul cost for the flexibility. +1 is the default.

flexibility.category.label: Category
flexibility.category.hint: The category of talents to choose from.

flexibility.tier.label: Tier
flexibility.tier.hint: The tier of talents to choose from.

condition.label: Activation Conditions
condition.hint: Overrides the always active setting. If this field is empty, the always active setting is used.

check.label: Check
check.hint: The check(s) this favor applies to.

checks.label: Checks
checks.hint: The check(s) this favor applies to.

art.label: Artistry
art.hint: The artistry the feature belongs to.

cost.label: Cost
cost.hint: The PP cost of the feature.

costMultiplier.label: Cost Multiplier
costMultiplier.hint: The multiplier (typically the 'X' value) for the cost of the feature.

SpecialistTalent.talentTreeRequirements: Talent Tree Requirements (all talents in tree unlocked)
SpecialistTalent.singleTalentTreeRequirements: At least one talent in this tree unlocked (talent tree name contains value)

select.label: Select
select.hint: Select an option from the presented list.
